input_text:
Job Title: Test Controls Software Engineer

Location: Greater Houston

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
Embedded Software Test Engineer (Controls)
Daikin Comfort Technologies Manufacturing, L.P. is seeking a skilled individual for our Controls Software Test Engineer position at our DTTP - Waller, TX location. The Controls Software Test Engineer will ensure that, through comprehensive testing, high quality software is developed and delivered. Will be responsible for creating software test design, test setup, scripting and execution. Should have ability to understand software requirements, create test cases, associate test data, execute tests, analyze test results, communicate findings to stakeholders, track and coordinate defect resolution. Qualified candidates for this role must have Controls Systems experience with at least 3 years of Embedded Testing experience. Responsibilities may include:
Analyze and understand software requirements to generate a clear software test plan and test schedule.Design and implement automatic test scripts and manual test procedures that conform to product requirements and defined functionality specifications, design documents, and external application standards.Hold test readiness review to ensure business understands test schedule, coverage and risks.Generate Electrical diagrams for test setups. Electrical wiring of test setups.Concisely and accurately report any defects, technical details & status and document each bug, fixes and different phase of software test.Generate test reports, status, and coverages and present to management team and program technical reviews.Work with the software engineers for the software issue debugging when necessary.Provide schedule and cost estimates and technical approach for software test projects.
Qualifications
BS in Electrical Engineering or computer science or related field is a must.Working software test experience with HVAC or thermostat or other controls products is strongly preferred.5+ years working experience with leading manual and automated tests for cloud, embedded and mobile (iOS, Android) softwareMinimum of 5 years of experience testing in web, mobile or embedded softwareMinimum of 2 years of hands-on experience with software automation test developmentExperience in using following programming language is highly desired: C#, C/C++, JS, Python.
Qualified Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.
The Company provides equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants regardless of a person’s race, color, religion (including religious dress or grooming practices), creed, national origin (including language use restrictions), citizenship, uniform service member or veteran status, ancestry, disability, physical or mental disability (including HIV/AIDS), medical condition (including cancer and genetic characteristics), genetic information, request for protected leave, marital status, sex, pregnancy, age (over 40), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, political affiliation, or any other characteristic protected by law. The Company will comply with all federal and state regulations and statutes pertaining to individuals with disabilities.

Experience Level (if available): Associate

output_json.title: Test Controls Software Engineer
output_json.summary: Daikin Comfort Technologies Manufacturing, L.P. seeks a Controls Software Test Engineer with 3+ years of Embedded Testing experience.
job_responsibilities: Analyze software requirements to generate a clear software test plan and test schedule.
Design and implement automatic test scripts and manual test procedures.
Hold test readiness review to ensure business understands test schedule, coverage, and risks.
Generate Electrical diagrams for test setups.
Concisely and accurately report defects, technical details, and status.
Document each bug, fixes, and different phases of software test.
Generate test reports, status, and coverages.
Present to management team and program technical reviews.
Work with software engineers for software issue debugging.
Provide schedule and cost estimates and technical approach for software test projects.
